div.div: Size of this PNG preview of this SVG file: 800 × 107 pixels. Other resolutions: 320 × 43 pixels | 640 × 85 pixels | 1,024 × 137 pixels | 1,280 × 171 pixels | 2,250 × 300 pixels.
Original file ‎(SVG file, nominally 2,250 × 300 pixels, file size: 92 KB)

tr.td:
This is a file from the Wikimedia Commons. Information from its description page there is shown below.
Commons is a freely licensed media file repository. You can help.

td.div:
English: Unit circles in the two-dimensional
ℓ
p
{\displaystyle \ell ^{p}}
space for various values of
p
{\displaystyle p}
.
Some special cases:
When p = 2/3 (0.666...), its shape coincides with an astroid
When p = 1, it represents the Manhattan distance
When p = 2, it represents the Euclidean distance
When p = 4, its shape coincides with a squircle
When p = ∞, it represents the Chebyshev distance

table.style: clear:both; margin:0.5em auto; background-color:#f0f0f0; border:2px solid #e0e0e0; direction: ltr;
